content:
• Wednesday, November 14, 2012
  • DRYS

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q3 misses bottom line estimates versus the Street on greater...

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q3 misses bottom line estimates versus the Street on greater than expected losses as the dry bulk shipper was impacted by depressed tanker rates and sharply higher drilling rig operating expenses, which masked an overall 7.8% Y/Y increase in total revenue. Drilling rigs operating expenses jumped 89%, while depreciation and amortization expenses were up 19%. Shares -8.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM
  • PETM

    More on PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM): Q3 beats on a per share basis on a 9% Y/Y jump in total revenue....

    More on PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM): Q3 beats on a per share basis on a 9% Y/Y jump in total revenue. Net profit grew a better-than-expected 47% as same-store sales and margins continue to improve. Separately, the company announces that its CFO, Chip Molloy, will be resigning in early 2014 to allow him to spend more time with his family. Mr. Molloy will continue to serve in the position until June 2013, and will remain with the company as a special advisor until March 2014. Shares +5.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • PTGI

    Primus Telecom (NYSE:PTGI) +9.9% AH to $14.05 after announcing a $2.50/share special dividend....

    Primus Telecom (NYSE:PTGI) +9.9% AH to $14.05 after announcing a $2.50/share special dividend. The dividend will be paid on Dec. 11 to shareholders on record as of Nov. 27. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • DRYS

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q3 EPS of -$0.09 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $343.6M (+7.8% Y/Y) beats...

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q3 EPS of -$0.09 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $343.6M (+7.8% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) -18.7% AH after restating results for FY10 and FY11, and reporting...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) -18.7% AH after restating results for FY10 and FY11, and reporting results for the first 3 quarters of FY12 (ended in July). Sales for the first 3 quarters totaled $757.4M (+3.5% Y/Y) and EPS amounted to $0.53, down from a restated $1.54 for the year-ago period. Gross margin fell 480 bps Y/Y to 18.1% thanks to (surprise, surprise) a drop in walnut crop deliveries and higher walnut costs. Diamond expects to report FY12 sales of $950M-$975M vs. FY11's $966.7M. Also, two board members are stepping down, and walnut grower Bill Tos is joining.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • NTAP

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NTAP +12.1%. PACTV +7.2%. PETM +6.5%. OTC:CALI +5.6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NTAP +12.1%. PACTV +7.2%. PETM +6.5%. OTC:CALI +5.6%. SZYM +5.1%.
    After-hours top losers: VELT -23.2%. DMND -16.9%. SB -13.4%. VGR -5.7%. MHD -4.4%.
     
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT) now -21.7% AH in response to its Q3 report. In addition to missing EPS estimates,...

    Velti (VELT) now -21.7% AH in response to its Q3 report. In addition to missing EPS estimates, the mobile ad agency said it will divest assets in regions with very high collection times (the PIIGS, North Africa, the Middle East) for $23.5M or more. Velti's collection times have long worried many investors. Thanks to the deal, Velti is hoping to see its DSO fall below 180 days (still high) by the end of 2013, compared with Q3's 242 days. It expects Q4 revenue from continuing ops of $97M-$113M, compared with a consensus for total revenue of $121.2M. CC underway (webcast). (slides) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • NAII

    Natural Alternatives International (NASDAQ:NAII): Q3 EPS of $0.10 in-line. Revenue of $16.5M...

    Natural Alternatives International (NASDAQ:NAII): Q3 EPS of $0.10 in-line. Revenue of $16.5M (-10.3% Y/Y). Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • LB

    Limited Brands (LTD): Q3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.05B in-line. Shares -1.1%...

    Limited Brands (LTD): Q3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.05B in-line. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • NTAP

    More on NetApp's FQ2: Shares benefiting from low expectations. Product sales -2% Y/Y (about even...

    More on NetApp's FQ2: Shares benefiting from low expectations. Product sales -2% Y/Y (about even with EMC's storage growth), software updates/maintenance +11%, services +12%. Americas flat Y/Y, EMEA +2%, Asia-Pac +14%. Diluted shares fell by 3M Q/Q (boosted EPS). Free cash flow of $269M well above net income of $189M. Gross margin was 60.6%, up 30 bps Q/Q and down 130 bps Y/Y. Opex +8% Y/Y, exceeding revenue growth. Deferred revenue flat Q/Q at $2.77B. NTAP +9.9% AH. EMC +1.5%. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR) (supplemental comments)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • WSM

    More on Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q3 beats across the board on a 9% Y/Y jump in total sales....

    More on Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q3 beats across the board on a 9% Y/Y jump in total sales. Operating margin increased to 8.4% from 7.9%, which, along with approximately $31M in share buybacks over the quarter, gave a big boost to its per share performance. For FY 2012 however, the company sets its EPS guidance range at between $2.45 to $2.52 per share, below Street expectations for $2.55 per share. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM): Q3 EPS of -$0.32 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $8.58M (-3.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Solazyme (SZYM): Q3 EPS of -$0.32 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $8.58M (-3.4% Y/Y) misses by $0.25M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $945M (+9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $945M (+9% Y/Y) beats by $24M. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • SB

    Safe Bulkers (NYSE:SB): Q3 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $46.8M (+10.1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Safe Bulkers (NYSE:SB): Q3 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $46.8M (+10.1% Y/Y) beats by $1.8M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.54B (+2% Y/Y) in-line....

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.54B (+2% Y/Y) in-line. Expects FQ3 revenue of $1.575B-$1.675B, in-line with $1.62B consensus. Expects FQ3 EPS of $0.53-$0.58, in-line with $0.54 consensus. New $1.5B stock buyback authorization approved. Shares +7.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • PETM

    PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM): Q3 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $1.6B (+9% Y/Y) in-line....

    PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM): Q3 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $1.6B (+9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • TSL

    Solar stocks close with big losses (TAN -4.3%) on a bad day for high-beta tech firms not named...

    Solar stocks close with big losses (TAN -4.3%) on a bad day for high-beta tech firms not named Facebook. Trina (TSL -18.3%) is now down 27% since slashing guidance on Monday morning. STP -11.9%. LDK -7.5%. SPWR -6.7%. CSIQ -9.2%. (LDK deal termination)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • MM

    Shares of volatile Millennial Media (MM -11.4%) have crumbled today in the absence of major...

    Shares of volatile Millennial Media (MM -11.4%) have crumbled today in the absence of major news. The decline comes 9 days after Millennial posted a Q3 beat and provided in-line guidance. Mobile ad peer Velti reports after the bell.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • GWW

    W.W. Grainger (GWW -2.5%) issues Q4 guidance, seeing EPS of $2.55-$2.75 excluding non-recurring...

    W.W. Grainger (GWW -2.5%) issues Q4 guidance, seeing EPS of $2.55-$2.75 excluding non-recurring items vs. $2.55 analyst consensus, and revenues rising 7%-9% Y/Y to $2.22B-$2.26B vs. $2.25B consensus. GWW sees FY 2013 EPS of $10.85-$12.00 vs. $12.04 consensus, and revenues of $9.19M-$9.73M vs. $9.69B consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -3.7%) slump off of a report from Bloomberg tipping off the...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -3.7%) slump off of a report from Bloomberg tipping off the company failed to find a bidder as high-profile P-E firms took a pass on buying the online jobs site as a whole. Analysts still think a deal could go off if the Monster allows parts of the company to be sliced off in a partial sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • SBUX

    More on the Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) - Teavana (TEA) deal: The company says it will add a...

    More on the Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) - Teavana (TEA) deal: The company says it will add a high-profile neighborhood concept to the Teavana brand's footprint in U.S. malls coast to coast. With the Tazo business already under its corporate umbrella, Starbucks says a two-two-tiered market position will be created. But is tea really the new coffee in the U.S. or is this an international play by Starbucks? Post-deal: SBUX -2.3%, TEA +52.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAS

    Specialty metals and plastics distributor A.M. Castle (CAS +4%) moves higher today after Huber...

    Specialty metals and plastics distributor A.M. Castle (CAS +4%) moves higher today after Huber Capital Management revealed an 8.2% stake in the firm. Huber had intended to purchase up to a 15% stake without triggering the company's antitakeover measure, but saw its request rejected by the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (SBUX -1.8%) confirms it will buy Teavana (TEA +27.5%) for $15.50 a share. The company...

    Starbucks (SBUX -1.8%) confirms it will buy Teavana (TEA +27.5%) for $15.50 a share. The company expects the deal to be accretive to 2013 earnings by a penny a share. An interesting side note is that Teavana was taken public just 16 months ago by Goldman Sachs and Bank of America at $17 bucks a share.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD -4.6%) shares continue their roller-coaster ride started when TPG-Axon...

    SandRidge Energy (SD -4.6%) shares continue their roller-coaster ride started when TPG-Axon Capital began agitating for a board shake-up, CEO ouster and a possible sale. TPG-Axon's larger stake could mean even more volatility; Tudor Pickering says the activist investor is “the one wildcard in the mix” with “the potential for their interests to impact corporate direction and stock price."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASMB

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS +5.3%) moves higher today, offsetting some of the losses from a lower...

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS +5.3%) moves higher today, offsetting some of the losses from a lower than expected Q3 EPS yesterday. Cantor Fitzgerald thinks the results were "meaningless" and the stock is extremely undervalued. The firm believes the market is too deeply discounting the company's diltiazem hydrochloride cream, a treatment for anal fissures currently in Phase 3 testing. The drug suffered a setback recently when the FDA said it required a second Phase 3 study, but Cantor believes it should be market ready by the end of 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • KIOR

    Shares of KiOR (KIOR +6.7%), one of two companies that have built multimillion-dollar factories...

    Shares of KiOR (KIOR +6.7%), one of two companies that have built multimillion-dollar factories for cellulosic biofuels, are strong after NYT reports it is very close to beginning large-scale, commercial production and would begin shipping its "renewable crude” by the end of the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Teavana (TEA +27.5%) skyrocket after the Atlanta Business Chronicle reports Starbucks...

    Shares of Teavana (TEA +27.5%) skyrocket after the Atlanta Business Chronicle reports Starbucks (SBUX -1.8%) will announce tomorrow it plans to acquire the company. By buying the Teavana brand, Starbucks could jumpstart its entry into the tea-only store market.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • FE

    The utility sector is generally lower after New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo began an investigation...

    The utility sector is generally lower after New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo began an investigation into the state's utility providers, saying a major overhaul of the industry is needed. FirstEnergy (FE -1.3%), Northeast Utilities (NE -1.2%) and Westar Energy (WR -1.1%) are all down more than 1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P -2.9%) has slumped to new post-IPO lows today. Boutique equity trading firm National...

    Pandora (P -2.9%) has slumped to new post-IPO lows today. Boutique equity trading firm National Alliance has launched coverage with a Market Perform, arguing strong ad sales growth is offset by licensing costs and emerging competition from the likes of Apple and Spotify. Separately, 125 musicians have signed a letter opposing Pandora's efforts to bring Internet radio royalties in-line with satellite royalties, via the Internet Radio Fairness Act.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +21%) ramps significantly higher today after is Q3 loss came in...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +21%) ramps significantly higher today after is Q3 loss came in better than Street expectations. The company didn't report any revenues during the quarter. It ended the quarter with about $37.4M in cash and equivalents on hand, up significantly from the $13.2M deficit recorded at the end of 2011.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • NLNK

    Newlink Genetics (NLNK +4.3%) gains today after European regulators grant orphan drug status for...

    Newlink Genetics (NLNK +4.3%) gains today after European regulators grant orphan drug status for Algenpantucel-L, the company's off-the-shelf product candidate for treatment of pancreatic cancer. The drug is currently is in Phase III testing in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • NLST

    Netlist (OTC:NLST -25.9%) shares have tumbled to a mere $0.68 after the provider of server...

    Netlist (OTC:NLST -25.9%) shares have tumbled to a mere $0.68 after the provider of server memory modules badly missed Q3 estimates. Netlist blamed a major drop in sales of its mainstay PERC cache modules, and delays in ramping sales of its patent-protected HyperCloud and NVvault products. Cash and equivalents fell to $10.9M from Q2's $11.7M. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • ASTC

    Astrotech Corporation (ASTC -11.5%) takes a hit today after reporting a Q1 net loss of $0.07 per...

    Astrotech Corporation (ASTC -11.5%) takes a hit today after reporting a Q1 net loss of $0.07 per share or $1.4M, on revenues of $6.1M. The loss is wider than in the same period last year, when the commercial aerospace firm posted net loss of $666,000, or $0.04 per share on revenues od $4.8M. the company attributes the miss to a number of delayed launches in its schedule for the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -0.6%) show volatility after the firm is one of the sites...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -0.6%) show volatility after the firm is one of the sites included in a new Facebook jobs app that was announced earlier today.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • NTI

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI -8.5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank, which says...

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI -8.5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank, which says that although excellent Q3 profitability implies cheap valuation, it sees a seasonal sequential decline in earnings in Q4 followed by typically weak Q1 and costly turnarounds, and the stock looks fully valued on a normalized mid-cycle distribution basis.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +8.9%) uses its lockup expiration day to announce a long-rumored jobs app that...

    Facebook (FB +8.9%) uses its lockup expiration day to announce a long-rumored jobs app that allows recruiters to share listings. 1.7M listings are currently provided, and initial partners include Monster (NYSE:MWW) and BranchOut. LinkedIn (LNKD -1.4%), which received 55% of its Q3 revenue from job listing services, has spiked lower on the news. The general preference among LinkedIn users to keep their personal and professional social media identities separate could insulate the company. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 10 Comments
  • GEOS

    Geospace Technologies (GEOS +2%) signs a $160M contract with Statoil (STO) to do seismic...

    Geospace Technologies (GEOS +2%) signs a $160M contract with Statoil (STO) to do seismic monitoring for the Snorre and Grane fields on the Norwegian continental shelf. The news was expected but “represents a positive as the award is a significant size,” analysts at Simmons & Co. say; shares are up nearly 70% YTD vs. ~30% for its peer group.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD +2.2%) is seeing a much-needed rally after Pac Crest argues the company's...

    Dell (DELL-OLD +2.2%) is seeing a much-needed rally after Pac Crest argues the company's enterprise hardware/software/services ops, which now make up over half of gross profit, will offset PC weakness, and that downside is limited. Dell only trades around 4x EPS after backing out net cash, but revenue is steadily declining and earnings are being propped up by huge buybacks. FQ3 results arrive tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • CVV

    CVD Equipment (CVV +1%) says that due to a loss of power for an extended period of time due to...

    CVD Equipment (CVV +1%) says that due to a loss of power for an extended period of time due to Superstorm Sandy, the company has been granted permission by the SEC to delay filing its Form 10-Q for the quarter ended September 30. Although the company didn't sustain any physical damage to its facilities, its headquarters was shut down, thus delaying the completion of the forms.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (FRO +15.8%) shares are surging, perhaps related to bullish analyst comments on...

    Frontline (FRO +15.8%) shares are surging, perhaps related to bullish analyst comments on rallying VLCC spot rates. FRO has "the most exposure to spot VLCCs and are in line to benefit from these improving rates," Dahlman Rose writes; considering OSG's bankruptcy filing, investors should buy FRO, "especially since it is in a good financial position after its restructuring."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +3.5%) is higher today after pricing its previously announced 3.042M share...

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +3.5%) is higher today after pricing its previously announced 3.042M share secondary offering at $13.15 per share, just a slight discount to its Tuesday close. The company anticipates net proceeds from the sale to be approximately $37M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • DOV

    Barron's likes prospective double-digit earnings growth at Dover (DOV +1.7%) as well as strong...

    Barron's likes prospective double-digit earnings growth at Dover (DOV +1.7%) as well as strong cash flow supporting a 2.3% dividend yield and more small acquisitions, and it thinks shares could pop on a sale of its electronic assembly and test businesses. Shares are undervalued partly due to missteps on newly-acquired Sound Solutions, but it seems finally to be on the path to growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • KKR

    They're getting there. Closed-end investment funds take it on the chin again, with the PIMCO...

    They're getting there. Closed-end investment funds take it on the chin again, with the PIMCO High Income Fund (PHK -6.6%) leading. At $10.56, the fund no longer sports a ridiculous near-75% premium to NAV, but with NAV currently at $8.32, there remains a wide gulf.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 10 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -5.1%) has tumbled to new 52-week lows today, as worries persist about Qihoo's...

    Baidu (BIDU -5.1%) has tumbled to new 52-week lows today, as worries persist about Qihoo's search engine, mobile search share and monetization, and China's growth slowdown - shares have now tread water over the last 2 years, during which time Baidu's multiples have fallen sharply. SA's Efficient Alpha recently observed many of Baidu's multiples and financial metrics now compare favorably with Google's. (yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • MED

    Medifast (MED -4.6%) is down today after saying that its CFO Brendan Connors has resigned to...

    Medifast (MED -4.6%) is down today after saying that its CFO Brendan Connors has resigned to pursue other interests. The weight-loss program provider taps Senior Controller Edward Powers as interim financial chief until a successor can be found.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • LPRI

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR +8.6%) reports a Q3 loss of $0.14/share vs. expectations of an $0.08...

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR +8.6%) reports a Q3 loss of $0.14/share vs. expectations of an $0.08 loss, adjusted EBITDA of $27M (flat Q/Q) and average daily sales volume -17% Y/Y and -7% Q/Q. LPR also agrees to sell assets in the Wild River area of Alberta for C$82M and will use the proceeds to pay down debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB -4.3%) slips on disappointment that the FDA is giving a six...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB -4.3%) slips on disappointment that the FDA is giving a six month window to approve Lymphoseek, its Lymphoma diagnostic tool, rather than the two-month review time-frame some investors were betting on. The agency had rejected NAVB's first application in September, citing problems caused by its third-party manufacturer, and it now has to re-inspect the manufacturing site before deciding on the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +1.9%) is up a bit after announcing a big management shakeup - the company's...

    Zynga (ZNGA +1.9%) is up a bit after announcing a big management shakeup - the company's reiteration of 2012 guidance and Facebook's post-lockup expiration rally might be helping out. While calling departing CFO David Wehner "a capable executive," Wedbush's Michael Pachter thinks replacement Mark Vranesh can do a good job, and argues the promotions of three other execs "strengthen a management team that, quite frankly, was in need of reinforcement."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND -1.1%) cools off after surging close to 15% yesterday on news it will...

    Diamond Foods (DMND -1.1%) cools off after surging close to 15% yesterday on news it will finally restate financials for 2010 to 2012 later today. The common theme on the company is that the numbers won't look pretty, but by falling back into compliance Diamond will remain listed on the Nasdaq and could pick up a buyer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • SORL

    Shares of Sorl Auto Parts (SORL +7.5%) jumped out of the gate this morning after its Q3 bottom...

    Shares of Sorl Auto Parts (SORL +7.5%) jumped out of the gate this morning after its Q3 bottom line easily beat estimates, despite a slowdown in original equipment sales. Net income fell 4.2% Y/Y as sluggish new vehicle sales in China challenge its core revenue stream. The company noted however that the aging Chinese vehicle market is giving a boost to its aftermarket parts sales, and it raises FY earnings estimates to around $11.5M on sales of $191.4M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • CSCO

    Pac Crest's Brent Bracelin has upgraded Cisco (CSCO +6.4%) to Buy in response to its solid FQ1...

    Pac Crest's Brent Bracelin has upgraded Cisco (CSCO +6.4%) to Buy in response to its solid FQ1 results and FQ2 guidance. Cisco "could grow in 2013 and have stable to improving gross margin for the first time in two years," thinks Bracelin. Piper likes Cisco's sales execution and cost controls, and FBN notes shares trade at 5x EPS exc. cash. Europe is still a concern for many. FFIV +4%. JDSU +2.7%. XLNX +2.8%. BRCM +1.8%. CAVM +6.9%. FTNT +3.3%. ARUN +4.6%. (CC comments: I, II) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • RDS.A

    Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -1.5%) plans to invest more than $20B by 2015 to develop liquified...

    Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -1.5%) plans to invest more than $20B by 2015 to develop liquified natural gas and gas-to-liquids production, areas whose earnings reached $9B over the past year. Shell has 22M tons/year of LNG on stream, is building 7M tons/year of new LNG capacity in Australia, and seeks to add more than 20M tons/year of further LNG options in Australia, Indonesia and North America.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD (IAG -16.3%) completes the $30M sale of its Quimsacocha project in Ecuador to...

    IAMGOLD (IAG -16.3%) completes the $30M sale of its Quimsacocha project in Ecuador to INVMetals, but shares are crushed after reporting big Y/Y drops in Q3 earnings and revenues. Net earnings from continuing operations rose 56%, but the increase was mostly related to one-time items including higher derivative gains on commodity and foreign exchange contracts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Are we seeing a repeat of Yelp's lockup expiration? Facebook (FB +9.7%) has shot higher even...

    Are we seeing a repeat of Yelp's lockup expiration? Facebook (FB +9.7%) has shot higher even though 773M shares and 31M restricted stock units are eligible for sale for the first time. Short-covering is undoubtedly a factor, but Pivotal Research claims many institutions were waiting for the expiration to arrive to jump in. One potential risk: unlike Yelp, Facebook's expiration isn't centered around just a handful of insiders owning large stakes, but is spread out over many employees and investors.
